qas.question: LEDs are often used for what type of systems?
Why are LEDs preferred for machine vision systems?

answers.text: so features of interest are easier to process

qas.question: What can help make LEDs more widely used?
What is the most common example of a machine vision system?
Where are some LEDs in machine vision systems found?
non-LEDs are often used for what type of systems?
Why aren't LEDs preferred for machine vision systems?
What can't help make LEDs more widely used?
What is the most uncommon example of a machine vision system?
Where are some LEDs in machine vision systems not found?

context: <a0_0><b5_0>Machine vision<b5_0/><a0_0/> systems often require bright and homogeneous illumination, <a1_0>so features of interest are easier to process<a1_0/>. LEDs are often used for this purpose, and this is likely to remain one of their major uses until the <a2_0><b7_0>price drops<b7_0/><a2_0/> low enough to make signaling and <b6_0>illumination uses more widespread<b6_0/>. <a3_0><b8_0>Barcode scanners<b8_0/><a3_0/> are the most common example of machine vision, and many low cost products use red LEDs instead of lasers. <a4_0><b9_0>Optical computer mice<b9_0/><a4_0/> are an example of LEDs in machine vision, as it is used to provide an even light source on the surface for the miniature camera within the mouse. LEDs constitute a nearly ideal light source for machine vision systems for several reasons:
